intro: Alsine decipiens, commonly known as the false flax, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas. The plant has small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Alsine decipiens is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
